queries.description: Elastic File System (EFS) must be encrypted

files.expected_value: aws_efs_file_system[wordpress_efs].encrypted' should be defined and not null

queries.description: Query to find passwords and secrets in infrastructure code.

files.expected_value: Hardcoded secret key should not appear in source
files.actual_value: Hardcoded secret key appears in source

queries.query_name: Sensitive Port Is Exposed To Entire Network
queries.description: A sensitive port, such as port 23 or port 110, is open for the whole network in either TCP or UDP protocol

files.expected_value: HTTP (TCP:80) should not be allowed
HTTPS (TCP:443) should not be allowed

queries.description: Security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0:0 and/or ::/0

files.expected_value: One of 'ingress.cidr_blocks' not equal '0.0.0.0/0'
One of 'ingress.cidr_blocks' not equal '0.0.0.0/0'

queries.query_name: Auto Scaling Group With No Associated ELB
queries.description: AWS Auto Scaling Groups must have associated ELBs to ensure high availability and improve application performance. This means the attribute 'load_balancers' must be defined and not empty.

files.expected_value: aws_autoscaling_group[web_asg].load_balancers should be set and not empty

queries.description: AWS CloudFront distributions should have logging enabled to collect all viewer requests, which means the attribute 'logging_config' should be defined

files.expected_value: aws_cloudfront_distribution[wordpress_cdn].logging_config should be defined

queries.description: CloudFront Minimum Protocol version should be at least TLS 1.2

files.expected_value: resource.aws_cloudfront_distribution[wordpress_cdn].viewer_certificate' should be defined and not null

queries.description: All AWS CloudFront distributions should be integrated with the Web Application Firewall (AWS WAF) service

files.expected_value: 'web_acl_id'  should exist

queries.description: Check if CloudWatch logging is disabled for Route53 hosted zones

files.expected_value: 'aws_route53_query_log' should be set for respective 'aws_route53_zone'

queries.description: EC2 Instance should not have a public IP address.

files.expected_value: 'associate_public_ip_address' should be set to false

queries.description: EC2 Instance should have detailed monitoring enabled. With detailed monitoring enabled data is available in 1-minute periods

files.expected_value: 'monitoring' should be defined and not null

queries.description: ELB should have logging enabled to help on error investigation

files.expected_value: 'aws_elb[{{wordpress_alb}}].access_logs' should be defined and not null

queries.query_name: ElastiCache Nodes Not Created Across Multi AZ
queries.description: ElastiCache Nodes should be created across multi az, which means 'az_mode' should be set to 'cross-az' in multi nodes cluster

files.expected_value: 'az_mode' should be set and must be 'cross-az' in multi nodes cluster

queries.description: The HTTP port is open to the internet in a Security Group

files.expected_value: aws_security_group.ingress shouldn't open the HTTP port (80)

queries.description: Server Access Logging should be enabled on S3 Buckets so that all changes are logged and trackable

files.expected_value: 'logging' should be defined and not null

queries.description: S3 bucket should have versioning enabled

files.expected_value: 'versioning' should be true

queries.description: Every VPC resource should have an associated Flow Log

files.expected_value: aws_vpc[wordpress_vpc] should be the same as Flow Logs VPC id
files.actual_value: aws_vpc[wordpress_vpc] is not the same as Flow Logs VPC id

queries.description: VPC Subnet should not assign public IP

files.expected_value: aws_subnet[public].map_public_ip_on_launch should be set to false or undefined

queries.description: VPC should have a Network Firewall associated

files.expected_value: aws_vpc[wordpress_vpc] has an 'aws_networkfirewall_firewall' associated
files.actual_value: aws_vpc[wordpress_vpc] does not have an 'aws_networkfirewall_firewall' associated

queries.description: CloudFront web distributions should use custom (and not default) SSL certificates. Custom SSL certificates allow only defined users to access content by using an alternate domain name instead of the default one.

files.expected_value: aws_cloudfront_distribution[wordpress_cdn].viewer_certificate should be defined and not null

queries.description: Amazon Elastic Filesystem should have filesystem encryption enabled using KMS CMK customer-managed keys instead of AWS managed-keys

files.expected_value: aws_efs_file_system[wordpress_efs].kms_key_id' should be defined'

queries.description: ElastiCache should not use the default port (an attacker can easily guess the port). For engine set to Redis, the default port is 6379. The Memcached default port is 11211

files.expected_value: aws_elasticache_cluster.port should be defined and not null

queries.description: IAM Access Analyzer should be enabled and configured to continuously monitor resource permissions

files.expected_value: 'aws_accessanalyzer_analyzer' should be set

queries.description: EC2 Instances should be configured under a VPC network. AWS VPCs provide the controls to facilitate a formal process for approving and testing all network connections and changes to the firewall and router configurations.

files.expected_value: Attribute 'vpc_security_group_ids' should be defined and not null

queries.description: ElastiCache should have Redis enabled, since it covers Compliance Certifications such as FedRAMP, HIPAA, and PCI DSS. For more information, take a look at 'https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/mem-ug/SelectEngine.html'

files.expected_value: resource.aws_elasticache_cluster[wordpress_cache].engine should have Redis enabled

queries.description: AWS Shield Advanced should be used for Amazon Route 53 hosted zone, AWS Global Accelerator accelerator, Elastic IP Address, Elastic Load Balancing, and Amazon CloudFront Distribution to protect these resources against robust DDoS attacks

files.expected_value: aws_cloudfront_distribution has shield advanced associated
files.actual_value: aws_cloudfront_distribution does not have shield advanced associated

files.expected_value: aws_route53_zone has shield advanced associated
files.actual_value: aws_route53_zone does not have shield advanced associated

queries.description: It's considered a best practice for an EC2 instance to use an EBS optimized instance. This provides the best performance for your EBS volumes by minimizing contention between Amazon EBS I/O and other traffic from your instance

files.expected_value: 'ebs_optimized' should be set to true

queries.description: All outputs should contain a valid description.

files.expected_value: 'description' should be defined and not null
'description' should be defined and not null
'description' should be defined and not null
'description' should be defined and not null

files.actual_value: aws_s3_bucket[{{wordpress_assets}}].tags does not have additional tags defined other than 'Name'

queries.description: It's considered a best practice for all rules in AWS Security Group to have a description

aws_security_group[{{db_sg}}].egress description should be defined and not null
files.actual_value: aws_security_group[{{db_sg}}].egress description is undefined or null
